intro: [WRONG START] Thtodaya microphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock heath, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It is a small, evergreen shrub that typically grows in rocky and coastal environments. The plant features narrow, leathery leaves that are adapted to withstand harsh coastal conditions. Its small, fragrant flowers are usually white or pale pink and bloom in spring. Thtodaya microphylla is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in difficult soil conditions.
